com.team09.qanda.views

Class MainActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • com.team09.qanda.views.MainActivity

  • public class MainActivity
extends Activity
    This class is the activity for the main screen of the app. It displays a list of all the questions and allows the user to navigate to other screens.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)

      • setUsername

        public void setUsername()
        This method creates a prompt for setting username Once the username has been set, it can never be changed. The user can choose to skip setting a username which will make the system generate a random username during the app use. The app will once again prompt the user for a username the next time the user opens the app if they skipped setting a username.

      • loadMore

        public void loadMore(View v)
        This method loads more threads using the elastic search handler through a thread list controller and notifies the adapter. It adds up to 10 more questions every time it is clicked to the current list of questions in the MainActivity
        Parameters:
        -

      • addQuestion

        public void addQuestion(View v)
        This method starts the add question thread activity. The adding of the question thread is done within the AddQuestion Activity
        Parameters:
        -

      • userThreadsActivity

        public void userThreadsActivity(java.lang.String FILENAME)
        This method allows navigation to lists of locally saved questions (favourites, my questions and read laters) upon selection from the menu. It starts the UserThreadsActivityto display these lists.
        Parameters:
        FILENAME - The file which saves the questions locally

      • onScreenHelp

        public void onScreenHelp()
        This method opens up the on-Screen Help dialog when called The on-Screen Help dialog contains helpful information regarding the current screen/activity the user is in. The information is stored in the res/layouts directory. This activity's help information is stored in res/layouts/main_help.xml
        Parameters:
        -
